problem.markdown:
>>We are not happy with the production rate of good parts. Somebody got the idea that if we could simply skip state 3 (ie, if we were to tell the operator to make the machine jump from state 3 to state 4 immediately after entering state 3), we would raise the yield. Is that true?<<
( ) Yes (x) No
[Explanation] By setting \(P_3=0\) and resolving the system of equations, we now spend less time in up states, so the total production rate actualy drops to 90.47 parts per hour. [Explanation]
